Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as an exaggeration because it states that President Obama "saved more than 1 million middle-class jobs all across America," which could be seen as an overstatement of the impact of the auto rescue.
Understate: There is no indication of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim falters at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific evidence or data to support the number of jobs saved, making it potentially lacking enough support.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all the jobs saved were middle-class jobs, which may be a problematic assumption as it is not clearly defined or supported.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
